question: What is an example of a syntax error in Python?

answer_choices.c: Trying to open a non-existent file
answer_choices.d: Using the wrong type of argument in a function

question: Which block in a try-except statement is executed regardless of an exception occurring?
What type of error is raised when an operation is performed on an inappropriate type of object?
How do you manually raise an exception in Python?
What happens if you put code inside the finally block of a try-except statement?

answer_choices.b: It executes regardless of whether an exception occurs
answer_choices.c: It only executes if an exception occurs
